Marvel's Spider-Man Remastered for PC is a superb superhero gaming experience that truly shines with its captivating narrative. The story takes center stage and keeps players engrossed throughout. The game's swinging mechanics and the sprawling open world of New York City are equally impressive. Swinging through the city is a pure joy, offering an unparalleled sense of freedom and exhilaration. The attention to detail in recreating the city is commendable. While the core gameplay mechanics remain faithful to the original, the enhanced visuals on PC breathe new life into this beloved title. Marvel's Spider-Man Remastered is a must-play for fans of the web-slinger and open-world gaming enthusiasts alike.

Whilst this game's mechanics are trumped by the much more refined Spider-man 2 that was recently released, this game is still by far my favourite super hero game of all time. Satisfying combat system, great story and voice acting, beautiful graphics, amazing performance, and just to top it all off, the best swinging mechanics in any Spider-man game yet!

If you end up enjoying this game, strongly recommend also buying the second one or just skipping this one and going for the second one straight away (if you're not too concerned about backstory)

Overall I'd probably give the game an 8/10 (would have been a 9 if I didn't know how much better the sequel would be).

I completed Marvel's Spider-Man 2 and earned the platinum trophy on PlayStation. The excitement didn't fade, prompting me to instantly purchase the Spider-Man Remastered without any doubts. Upon diving into the Remastered version, I was pleasantly surprised. The graphics are undeniably impressive, adding to the game's overall appeal. For fellow Spider-Man enthusiasts eagerly awaiting Spider-Man 2 Remastered's release on PC, this is a must-play. Although the PC version might take a while, who knows what the future holds? Stay optimistic! 😄

This game is worth the purchase for sure. You unlock all dlc content with this pc port of the game and along with it comes the experience that any Spider-man fan could've asked for. I've gotten to 100% the game quite easily and I'm sure you could do the same too. I find 100% a major addiction to accomplish with this game, the web swinging is fun and simple as well as the combat within the game yet it's always fun to mess around with. 

I personally prefer playing this game with a controller, a recommendation? definitely get a dualsense playstation 4 or 5 controller to feel great haptic feedback and vibration which helps the game fell more immersive as you play as spider-man.

The game is beginner friendly.

HOWEVER. What I dislike is how the game is displayed at full price, I heavily recommend getting the game when it is on sale rather than paying full price. Though that's just my opinion.

The story isn't too long but also isn't too short for the player. It took me around 28 hours to finish the game with 100% Dlc included.

The game offers a new game+ save which makes it where you can play/restart the game from the very beginning while keeping all of your progress. I have finished the game on spectacular difficulty which in my opinion wasn't so hard. After finishing the game you'll also have access to the hardest difficulty that game offers; Ultimate difficulty. Again, I don't find it difficult whatsoever and as I've mentioned before. This game was found very addicting to play to the point where you as the player may be wanting more.

A sequel for this game has been released already (Spider-man Miles Morales) and I can say the same for it, it isn't as long as this game but the web swinging and content is far more enjoyable in my opinion.

Best $65 Aud spent so far. Disclaimer; I got the game when it was on sale.

As a note, when there is a festive sale currently going on with steam, the Marvel spider-man games are usually on sale together.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.
My brother and I have both beat this game twice. It is so much fun and I highly recommend it. Can't wait to play through 2! Also Adam says hello.

I’ve had it on ps4 and then got the remake, with the release of 2, I saw that the pc version had an update. At this point I finished spiderman 2 on ps5. I wanted to refresh my memory for the 2nd play through of spiderman 2 but for some reason this game has a ram memory leak issue on pc. Within the first 30 minutes to an hour the game goes from using 16gb in total to 27gb and that’s only if I close out the game since the game will start slowing down and dropping frames. I don’t know what you’ll did in this latest update but it’s messed up to the point where I can’t just play for a few minutes. Honestly disappointed, I’ve always had an high end pc and upgraded my pc just a few months ago as well for the 7950x3d cpu with a rtx 4090 with 6000mhz 64gb cl30 ram sticks. I did play it when it first released on pc too but it actually seems to run worse now because of the ram memory leak since the latest update. Honestly it’s a shame.

Console-to-PC ports are often fraught with technical issues, and this is no exception. The game's completely incompatible with SLI setups (it technically runs, but every other frame is a garbled mess of random colors and flashing lights, some real epileptic seizure-inducing stuff), and even after figuring that out and disabling SLI, I couldn't get it to recognize my gamepad, which ironically enough was a playstation controller.

But... when they let you play as OG Spider-Man, it's great.  Batman Arkham gameplay.

EDIT: Sad to see the new game (SM2) tripled down on being gayer and more diverse, while marginalizing Peter Parker further into obscurity.  I guess they wanted a higher "ESG social credit score," huh?

I played the PS4 version 5 years ago on launch and got the platinum trophy (100% completion) and saw this was on sale and wanted to prep myself for Spider-man 2.

First off the graphics are some of the best on PC. I'm playing on 1440p ultra-wide with Ray tracing on and everything on high and getting a solid 60-80 FPS on my 3070. If you have a fancy RTX 30 or 40 series card, here is a title to show off what Ray tracing brings to a game. With the thousands of buildings and glass windows in this game, RT is utilized better than most games and I would say I prefer to run it on and lower frames than turning it off and getting 140+ frames. 

I also like the implementation of the PS5 haptic feedback on PC, something other Sony titles have refused to implement, even Destiny now owned by Sony refuses to do this... 

Combat and story are top notch and even better on PC with unlocked frames and Ultra-wide support with FOV sliders. I never played the DLC for Spider-man on PS4 and looking forward to beating them on PC and moving onto Spider-man 2. 

Overall I am glad I bought the game on sale and if you are like me and owned the old PS4 version and If you got the PC to run it, I would def buy for a nice remaster of one the best superhero games ever made.

I would like to start this off by saying this: The game is overall pretty great!

However... there's an issue with some of the side objectives/challenges. Particularly the combat and stealth challenges. If you click Retry you will sometimes instantly crash. When this happens your Autosave is unusable and can't be loaded without crashing the game again. And with the game only having a single autosave slot, this is forcing you to go back to your previous Manual save. Potentially losing hours of gameplay.

So what started off as a game with fantastic flow of you going from mission to mission, challenge to challenge and running into the random crimes... has now screeched to a halt. In fear of once again losing a massive chunk of gameplay, I'm now stopping and manual saving before doing anything. And these constant breaks are no fun. 

Might change this review if I decide to go back to the game and continue. But after a couple times of this happening I'm putting this game down, at least for now.

Great new take on spider-man. This is old news for most but new for me since I'm an xbox/pc man. I love how Insomniac has spider-man stay true to his optimistic and light-hearted personality traits, while also exploring the more adult stories and moments filled with grief from within the comics. The combat does a great job of using what worked with Rocksteady's Arkham games and adding new features and moves more in line with Spider-man. Traversal likewise is incredible. Stealth is basic, but fun, in the shorter doses the game serves them to you in. Performance is solid too. I experience occasional stuttering and frame issues, but that may be related to my older SSD since most games seem to be made for NvMEs now. Great experience overall. 9/10.

Years of nostalgia for Spider-Man 2 (2004) have built it up in my head as an unimpeachable classic. That game helped me through a rough time in my life in which I needed an escape to a world in which I got to embody the Web Head and do good. Buying this game I always assumed that this game would be, in every way better, but would still pale in comparison to Spider-Man 2 (2004) in my nostalgia addled brain. I'm exceedingly happy to say that's not the case.

[b] Combat: [/b] Borrowing heavily from the Batman: Arkham _____ series by Rocksteady, the combat flows beautifully in this game. It plays so much like those games that my first 3 or so hours with the game were infuriating. I tried to use the same button layout (not easily remappable in-game for those wondering) and found myself web zipping straight into a thug's fist for WAY too long. Once my brain reoriented and I met the game where it was willing to meet me...this combat sings in a fantastic way. Combos are more forgiving than in the Arkham games and you are much more acrobatic as Spidey which lends to fun air combos and gadgets really make an already stylish game feel dynamic in a whole new way. So in short: Arkham but still with it's own identity and heart.

[b] Open World: [/b] The map is (as is the style of the time) littered with side activities, collection missions, and activities to keep you engaged. A 100% run of the game will most likely take you somewhere in the neighborhood of 35-40 hours and very little of that feels like a grind. Web swinging around the city is absolutely fantastic helped by a good deal of animation and Spider-Man panache. Tools for traversing Manhattan in whatever way feels most fun to you are readily available from the start and only get better as you upgrade.

[b] Story: [/b] In one sentence, it's one of the most heartfelt and engaging spider stories I've ever experienced. Those with an eye for any form of the Spider-Man story will probably find something to love here. A criticism that I've seen is that the story is predicable.  I can understand where that comes from, and I will still say that I was taken aback by the way characters who we've been familiar with for decades will act in new and interesting ways that kept me hooked throughout. I was legitimately surprised by some of the twists that came...even if they were common sense happenings given other Spider-Stories throughout history. The story tugs at the heartstrings for me as well and I had a good number of "I'm not crying, you're crying!" moments.

[b] One GLARING Technical Issue: [/b] As of writing for those of us playing on PC, we get a new and exciting feature that I don't see Playstation players discussing: we get random crashes and save file corruption!! Over the number of hours that I've played the game, I've had about 40-50 crashes to desktop that left my save file un-loadable lest the crash happen as I was trying to auto-load. Thankfully, two things have mitigated the time loss that nearly drove me insane the first time this happened to me: 1) manually save ALL THE TIME and 2) A manual registry edit found in this YouTube video. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BRzwC-Tsdws&ab_channel=AMGameGoesOn I highly recommended that you manually save before doing any story mission or open world event, and in the event that you NEED to load your last auto-save, use the registry edit to load the crashing save. I've seen other saying that lowering graphics options helped them load otherwise crashing saves, but that did not work for me personally. 

[b] Wrap-Up: [/b] Aside from that one issue that I've learned to live with, this is the unquestionably best Spider-Man gaming experiences you can have. Seriously, this game is stupendously good. If you've got the cash to burn, and you have any love for super-hero, open world video games, this is a wonderful achievement in gaming. It deserves the accolades it has received wholeheartedly.

Great game, but I experienced many problems with performance. Around 1 hour of play, the frame rate significantly drops and it becomes unbearable to play, even though my pc specs are above the recommended. I'm not the only one to experience this, and none of the fixes worked for me (I haven't tried the ps4 controller one, but I'm not spending the money just to make a test). Another issue is sometimes the game simply crashes in the loading screen. No error message, no warnings, just crashes. Overall, I believe it is a bad pc port problem.
